base.Browser.name: Browser
base.Browser.doc: This class provides access to G Suite specific dialog boxes.

method.name: inputBox
method.doc: Pops up a dialog box with a text input box in the user's browser.

argument.name: prompt
argument.doc: the text to be displayed in the dialog box

method.name: inputBox
method.doc: Pops up a dialog box with a text input box in the user's browser.

argument.name: prompt
argument.doc: the text to be displayed in the dialog box

argument.name: buttons
argument.doc: an enum from Browser.Buttons

method.name: inputBox
method.doc: Pops up a dialog box with a text input box in the user's browser.

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the title for the dialog box

argument.name: prompt
argument.doc: the text to be displayed in the dialog box

argument.name: buttons
argument.doc: an enum from Browser.Buttons

method.name: msgBox
method.doc: Pops up a dialog box with the given message and an OK button in the user's browser.

argument.name: prompt
argument.doc: the text to be displayed in the dialog box

method.name: msgBox
method.doc: Pops up a dialog box with the given message and specified buttons in the user's browser.

argument.name: prompt
argument.doc: the text to be displayed in the dialog box

argument.name: buttons
argument.doc: an enum from Browser.Buttons

method.name: msgBox
method.doc: Pops up a dialog box with the given title, message and specified buttons in the user's browser.

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the title of the dialog box

argument.name: prompt
argument.doc: the text to be displayed in the dialog box

argument.name: buttons
argument.doc: an enum from Browser.Buttons

base.Logger.name: Logger
base.Logger.doc: This class allows the developer to write out text to the debugging logs.

method.name: clear
method.doc: Clears the log.

method.name: getLog
method.doc: Returns a complete list of messages in the current log.

method.name: log
method.doc: Writes the string to the logging console.

argument.name: data
argument.doc: the message to log

method.name: log
method.doc: Writes a formatted string to the logging console, using the format and values provided.

argument.name: format
argument.doc: a format string that contains as many instances of %s as the number of values arguments

argument.name: values
argument.doc: a variable number of values to insert into the format string

base.MimeType.name: MimeType
base.MimeType.doc: An enumeration that provides access to MIME-type declarations without typing the strings explicitly. Any method that expects a MIME type rendered as a string (for example, 'image/png') will also accept one of the values below, so long as the method supports the underlying MIME type.

property.name: GOOGLE_APPS_SCRIPT
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a Google Apps Script project.

property.name: GOOGLE_DRAWINGS
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a Google Drawings file.

property.name: GOOGLE_DOCS
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a Google Docs file.

property.name: GOOGLE_FORMS
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a Google Forms file.

property.name: GOOGLE_SHEETS
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a Google Sheets file.

property.name: GOOGLE_SITES
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a Google Sites file.

property.name: GOOGLE_SLIDES
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a Google Slides file.

property.name: FOLDER
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a Google Drive folder.

property.name: BMP
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a BMP image file (typically .bmp).

property.name: GIF
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a GIF image file (typically .gif).

property.name: JPEG
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a JPEG image file (typically .jpg).

property.name: PNG
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a PNG image file (typically .png).

property.name: SVG
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for an SVG image file (typically .svg).

property.name: PDF
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a PDF file (typically .pdf).

property.name: CSS
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a CSS text file (typically .css).

property.name: CSV
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a CSV text file (typically .csv).

property.name: HTML
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for an HTML text file (typically .html).

property.name: JAVASCRIPT
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a JavaScript text file (typically .js).

property.name: PLAIN_TEXT
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a plain text file (typically .txt).

property.name: RTF
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a rich text file (typically .rtf).

property.name: OPENDOCUMENT_GRAPHICS
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for an OpenDocument graphics file (typically .odg).

property.name: OPENDOCUMENT_PRESENTATION
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for an OpenDocument presentation file (typically .odp).

property.name: OPENDOCUMENT_SPREADSHEET
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for an OpenDocument spreadsheet file (typically .ods).

property.name: OPENDOCUMENT_TEXT
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for an OpenDocument word-processing file (typically .odt).

property.name: MICROSOFT_EXCEL
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet file (typically .xlsx).

property.name: MICROSOFT_EXCEL_LEGACY
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a Microsoft Excel legacy file (typically .xls).

property.name: MICROSOFT_POWERPOINT
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a Microsoft PowerPoint presentation file (typically .pptx).

property.name: MICROSOFT_POWERPOINT_LEGACY
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a Microsoft PowerPoint legacy file (typically .ppt).

property.name: MICROSOFT_WORD
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a Microsoft Word document file (typically .docx).

property.name: MICROSOFT_WORD_LEGACY
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a Microsoft Word legacy file (typically .doc).

property.name: ZIP
property.doc: Representation of MIME type for a ZIP archive file (typically .zip).

base.Session.name: Session
base.Session.doc: The Session class provides access to session information, such as the user's email address (in some circumstances) and language setting.

method.name: getActiveUser
method.doc: Gets information about the current user.

method.name: getActiveUserLocale
method.doc: Gets the language setting of the current user as a stringâ€”for example, en for English.

method.name: getEffectiveUser
method.doc: Gets information about the user under whose authority the script is running.

method.name: getScriptTimeZone
method.doc: Gets the time zone of the script.

method.name: getTemporaryActiveUserKey
method.doc: Gets a temporary key that is unique to the active user but does not reveal the user identity.

base.console.name: console
base.console.doc: This class allows the developer to write logs to the Google Cloud Platform's Stackdriver Logging service. The following shows some logging examples:

method.name: error
method.doc: Outputs an ERROR level message to Stackdriver Logging.

argument.name: formatOrObject
argument.doc: a string containing zero or more substitution strings, or a JavaScript object to be logged as a JavaScript object if no other parameters.

argument.name: values
argument.doc: objects with which to replace substitution strings within the message. This gives you additional control over the format of the output.

method.name: info
method.doc: Outputs an INFO level message to Stackdriver Logging.

argument.name: formatOrObject
argument.doc: a string containing zero or more substitution strings, or a JavaScript object to be logged as a JavaScript object if no other parameters.

argument.name: values
argument.doc: objects with which to replace substitution strings within the message. This gives you additional control over the format of the output.

method.name: log
method.doc: Outputs a DEBUG level message to Stackdriver Logging.

argument.name: formatOrObject
argument.doc: a string containing zero or more substitution strings, or a JavaScript object to be logged as a JavaScript object if no other parameters.

argument.name: values
argument.doc: objects with which to replace substitution strings within the message. This gives you additional control over the format of the output.

method.name: time
method.doc: Starts a timer you can use to track how long an operation takes.

argument.name: label
argument.doc: The name to give the new timer.

method.name: timeEnd
method.doc: Stops a timer that was previously started by calling console.time().

argument.name: label
argument.doc: the name of the timer to stop.

method.name: warn
method.doc: Outputs a WARNING level message to Stackdriver Logging.

argument.name: formatOrObject
argument.doc: a string containing zero or more substitution strings, or a JavaScript object to be logged as a JavaScript object if no other parameters.

argument.name: values
argument.doc: objects with which to replace substitution strings within the message. This gives you additional control over the format of the output.

base.Blob.name: Blob
base.Blob.doc: A data interchange object for Apps Script services.

method.name: copyBlob
method.doc: Returns a copy of this blob.

method.name: getAs
method.doc: Return the data inside this object as a blob converted to the specified content type.

argument.name: contentType
argument.doc: the MIME type to convert to. For most blobs, 'application/pdf' is the only valid option. For images in BMP, GIF, JPEG, or PNG format, any of 'image/bmp', 'image/gif', 'image/jpeg', or 'image/png' are also valid.

method.name: getBytes
method.doc: Gets the data stored in this blob.

method.name: getContentType
method.doc: Gets the content type of the bytes in this blob.

method.name: getDataAsString
method.doc: Gets the data of this blob as a String with UTF-8 encoding.

method.name: getDataAsString
method.doc: Gets the data of this blob as a string with the specified encoding.

argument.name: charset
argument.doc: the charset to use in encoding the data in this blob as a string

method.name: getName
method.doc: Gets the name of this blob.

method.name: isGoogleType
method.doc: Returns whether this blob is a G Suite file (Sheets, Docs, etc.).

method.name: setBytes
method.doc: Sets the data stored in this blob.

argument.name: data
argument.doc: the new data

method.name: setContentType
method.doc: Sets the content type of the bytes in this blob.

argument.name: contentType
argument.doc: the new contentType

method.name: setContentTypeFromExtension
method.doc: Sets the content type of the bytes in this blob based on the file extension.

method.name: setDataFromString
method.doc: Sets the data of this blob from a string with UTF-8 encoding.

argument.name: string
argument.doc: the string data

method.name: setDataFromString
method.doc: Sets the data of this blob from a string with the specified encoding.

argument.name: string
argument.doc: the string data

argument.name: charset
argument.doc: the charset to use in interpreting the string as bytes

method.name: setName
method.doc: Sets the name of this blob.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the new name

base.Menu.name: Menu
base.Menu.doc: A custom menu in an instance of the user interface for a Google App. A script can only interact with the UI for the current instance of an open document or form, and only if the script is container-bound to the document or form. For more information, see the guide to menus.

method.name: addItem
method.doc: Adds an item to the menu.

argument.name: caption
argument.doc: the label for the menu item, with only the first word capitalized

argument.name: functionName
argument.doc: the name of the function to invoke when the user selects the item

method.name: addSeparator
method.doc: Adds a visual separator to the menu.

method.name: addSubMenu
method.doc: Adds a sub-menu to the menu.

argument.name: menu
argument.doc: the sub-menu, constructed like a top-level menu

method.name: addToUi
method.doc: Inserts the menu into the instance of the editor's user interface.

base.PromptResponse.name: PromptResponse
base.PromptResponse.doc: A response to a prompt dialog displayed in the user-interface environment for a Google App. The response contains any text the user entered in the dialog's input field and indicates which button the user clicked to dismiss the dialog.

method.name: getResponseText
method.doc: Gets the text that the user entered in the dialog's input field.

method.name: getSelectedButton
method.doc: Gets the button that the user clicked to dismiss the dialog.

base.Ui.name: Ui
base.Ui.doc: An instance of the user-interface environment for a Google App that allows the script to add features like menus, dialogs, and sidebars. A script can only interact with the UI for the current instance of an open editor, and only if the script is container-bound to the editor.

property.name: Button
property.doc: An enum representing predetermined, localized dialog buttons returned by an alert or PromptResponse.getSelectedButton() to indicate which button in a dialog the user clicked.

property.name: ButtonSet
property.doc: An enum representing predetermined, localized sets of one or more dialog buttons that can be added to an alert or a prompt.

method.name: alert
method.doc: Opens a dialog box in the user's editor with the given message and an "OK" button.

argument.name: prompt
argument.doc: the message to display in the dialog box

method.name: alert
method.doc: Opens a dialog box in the user's editor with the given message and set of buttons.

argument.name: prompt
argument.doc: the message to display in the dialog box

argument.name: buttons
argument.doc: the button set to display in the dialog box

method.name: alert
method.doc: Opens a dialog box in the user's editor with the given title, message, and set of buttons.

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the title to display above the dialog box

argument.name: prompt
argument.doc: the message to display in the dialog box

argument.name: buttons
argument.doc: the button set to display in the dialog box

method.name: createAddonMenu
method.doc: Creates a builder that can be used to insert a sub-menu into the editor's Add-on menu.

method.name: createMenu
method.doc: Creates a builder that can be used to add a menu to the editor's user interface.

argument.name: caption
argument.doc: the label for the menu, with all major words capitalized for a top-level menu, or only the first word capitalized for a sub-menu

method.name: prompt
method.doc: Opens an input dialog box in the user's editor with the given message and an "OK" button.

argument.name: prompt
argument.doc: the message to display in the dialog box

method.name: prompt
method.doc: Opens an input dialog box in the user's editor with the given message and set of buttons.

argument.name: prompt
argument.doc: the message to display in the dialog box

argument.name: buttons
argument.doc: the button set to display in the dialog box

method.name: prompt
method.doc: Opens an input dialog box in the user's editor with the given title, message, and set of buttons.

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the title to display above the dialog box

argument.name: prompt
argument.doc: the message to display in the dialog box

argument.name: buttons
argument.doc: the button set to display in the dialog box

method.name: showModalDialog
method.doc: Opens a modal dialog box in the user's editor with custom client-side content.

argument.name: userInterface
argument.doc: an HtmlOutput or UiInstance web app

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the title of the dialog; overrides any title set by calling setTitle() on the userInterface object

method.name: showModelessDialog
method.doc: Opens a modeless dialog box in the user's editor with custom client-side content.

argument.name: userInterface
argument.doc: an HtmlOutput or UiInstance web app

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the title of the dialog; overrides any title set by calling setTitle() on the userInterface object

method.name: showSidebar
method.doc: Opens a sidebar in the user's editor with custom client-side content.

argument.name: userInterface
argument.doc: an HtmlOutput or UiInstance web app

base.User.name: User
base.User.doc: Representation of a user, suitable for scripting.

method.name: getEmail
method.doc: Gets the user's email address, if available.

base.BlobSource.name: BlobSource
base.BlobSource.doc: Interface for objects that can export their data as a Blob.

method.name: getAs
method.doc: Return the data inside this object as a blob converted to the specified content type.

argument.name: contentType
argument.doc: the MIME type to convert to. For most blobs, 'application/pdf' is the only valid option. For images in BMP, GIF, JPEG, or PNG format, any of 'image/bmp', 'image/gif', 'image/jpeg', or 'image/png' are also valid.

method.name: getBlob
method.doc: Return the data inside this object as a blob.

base.Button.name: Button
base.Button.doc: An enum representing predetermined, localized dialog buttons returned by an alert or PromptResponse.getSelectedButton() to indicate which button in a dialog the user clicked. These values cannot be set; to add buttons to an alert or prompt, use ButtonSet instead.

property.name: CLOSE
property.doc: The standard close button displayed in every dialog's title bar. This button is not explicitly added to a dialog, and it cannot be removed.

property.name: OK
property.doc: An "OK" button, indicating that an operation should proceed.

property.name: CANCEL
property.doc: A "Cancel" button, indicating that an operation should not proceed.

property.name: YES
property.doc: A "Yes" button, indicating a positive response to a question.

property.name: NO
property.doc: A "No" button, indicating a negative response to a question.

base.ButtonSet.name: ButtonSet
base.ButtonSet.doc: An enum representing predetermined, localized sets of one or more dialog buttons that can be added to an alert or a prompt. To determine which button the user clicked, use Button.

property.name: OK
property.doc: A single "OK" button, indicating an informational message that can only be dismissed.

property.name: OK_CANCEL
property.doc: An "OK" button and a "Cancel" button, allowing the user to either proceed with or halt an operation.

property.name: YES_NO
property.doc: A "Yes" button and a "No" button, allowing the user to answer a yes/no question.

property.name: YES_NO_CANCEL
property.doc: A "Yes" button, a "No" button, and a "Cancel" button, allowing the user to either answer a yes/no question or halt an operation.

base.Month.name: Month
base.Month.doc: An enum representing the months of the year.

property.name: JANUARY
property.doc: January (month 1).

property.name: FEBRUARY
property.doc: February (month 2).

property.name: MARCH
property.doc: March (month 3).

property.name: APRIL
property.doc: April (month 4).

property.name: MAY
property.doc: May (month 5).

property.name: JUNE
property.doc: June (month 6).

property.name: JULY
property.doc: July (month 7).

property.name: AUGUST
property.doc: August (month 8).

property.name: SEPTEMBER
property.doc: September (month 9).

property.name: OCTOBER
property.doc: October (month 10).

property.name: NOVEMBER
property.doc: November (month 11).

property.name: DECEMBER
property.doc: December (month 12).

base.Weekday.name: Weekday
base.Weekday.doc: An enum representing the days of the week.

property.name: SUNDAY
property.doc: Sunday.

property.name: MONDAY
property.doc: Monday.

property.name: TUESDAY
property.doc: Tuesday.

property.name: WEDNESDAY
property.doc: Wednesday.

property.name: THURSDAY
property.doc: Thursday.

property.name: FRIDAY
property.doc: Friday.

property.name: SATURDAY
property.doc: Saturday.
